subject: Why does BaseTestRunner require TestCase class rather than the Test interface?

messageBody:
Hi,

We're having trouble with JUnit 4 which appears to be due to a small
change that was made in to BaseTestRunner. The problem is a
ClassCastException in BaseTestRunner when loading our suite class. In
JUnit 3, it didn't matter what type of class was loaded as long as it
had a static suite() method with no arguments. But now in JUnit 4,
the class must extend TestCase. I don't understand why this is
necessary - the getTest() method returns the Test interface and
internally it still uses reflection to get the static suite() method.
So why does the code cast the Class to a TestCase? It seems like
this is a case of overzealous use of the new parameterized types in
Java 5 and a regression from JUnit 3.

Also, in JUnit 3 the method loadSuiteClass() called getLoader() to get
the ClassLoader to use, which opened the door for extensibility. This
is gone now, why?

Thanks in advance...
